meanings.definition: To behave in a superior or condescending manner.
meanings.sent1: She would often snoot at others who didn't meet her standards.
meanings.sent2: He tends to snoot when he thinks he knows better than everyone else.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to snoot at the other pets in the house, thinking she was the boss.
meanings.sent4: The rich lady would snoot at anyone she deemed beneath her social status.
meanings.sent5: The teacher didn't appreciate the student's snooting attitude towards classmates.

meanings.definition: A nozzle or spout, especially on a pot or teapot.
meanings.sent1: The teapot's snoot poured the hot tea into the cup.
meanings.sent2: The watering can had a long snoot for precise watering of plants.
meanings.sent3: The snoot of the oil can leaked, making a mess on the garage floor.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter aimed the hose's snoot at the burning building.
meanings.sent5: The coffee pot's snoot made it easy to pour without spilling.
